subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Francis of Assisi: The Radical Saint
description: A short lesson to help you apply Francis of Assisi: The Radical Saint.

hook.text: A rich man's son stripped naked in public, gave away everything, and lived with lepers. Francis chose radical poverty.

buildup.text: Born wealthy in 1182, Francis heard God say 'rebuild my church.' He took it literally, then spiritually.

discovery.text: He founded the Franciscan order: monks who owned nothing, begged for food, and served the poorest of the poor.

twist.text: Francis preached to birds and called the sun 'brother.' His ecology of faith was 800 years ahead of its time.

climax.text: Pope Francis chose his name for a reason. Eight centuries later, this saint's radical simplicity still challenges.

punchline.text: Francis gave up wealth for poverty. 800 years later, his challenge remains.

quiz.question: What was radical about Francis of Assisi?
options: He embraced total poverty and service to the poorest
